Class GridJob

java.lang.Object
  GridJob
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataJob
public abstract class GridJob
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Legned.
+ Required, provided by the source
- Optional
+- Required when forcing the job
++ Provided by Schedular and read

	Class Description:
	++ JobId : An ID which uniquely identifies the job. This will be provided by the schdular.
	+ Source: Depicts the source of the job, provided by the source of the job. It will be the IP address of the computer.
	+ ServiceName: Name of the service to call. Example: Math,DataStorage
	+- Handle: Describes the handle which actually call the service. Example rmi://192.168.0.1/Math 
	+- Type: Describes the type of the service. Example: RMI
	+ Force: True or False value provided by the source. True value for source makes the schedular to send
	 the job to the specific computer.
	+ Intensity: Describes the type of the job. Possible values are
	Data,Computation,Data & Computation
	+- Destination: IP address of the computer hosting the service

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

COMPUTATION_INTENSIVE

public static final int COMPUTATION_INTENSIVE
Value to be set for the intensity field if the job is computation intensive. If this value is given shedular will check only the CPU and Memory resources while submitting the job to the machines participating on GRID.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DATA_INTENSIVE

public static final int DATA_INTENSIVE
Value to be set for the intensity field if the job is Data intensive. If this value is given shedular will check only the Disk resources while submitting the job to the machines participating on GRID.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DATA_AND_COMPUTATION_IENTENSIVE

public static final int DATA_AND_COMPUTATION_IENTENSIVE
Value to be set for the intensity field if the job is cmputation and Data intensive. If this value is given shedular will check only the CPU,Memory and Data resources while submitting the job to the machines participating to GRID.

See Also:
